file_content.text: Your part is done.
Major--this is Senator Evran. We have a serious problem.
Agent Kellor's team discovered where the Empire is hiding their bomb--but not before being spotted by Imperial security.
The team's speeder was damaged during their escape. They've crash-landed in the Dark Heart, part of the Nightmare Lands! You have to get there right away!
I'll move out immediately, sir.
Copy that.
Thank you. Good luck.
Good. Be careful, Major.
Hold a minute for intel. Koru?
These don't sound like very nice places.
Dark Heart? Nightmare Lands?
They aren't. Please hurry, Major.
They're not. Go as fast as you can, Major.
They aren't. Tell her what you've heard, Koru.
They're not. Koru, tell him what you've learned.
Isn't there anyone closer that you could send?
Not another rescue op.
There is no one else--the area is extremely dangerous.
Get to the crash site as soon as possible, Major. There's no time to waste.
Get there right away, Major. There's no telling how long they can hold out.
The Nightmare Lands are no place for the unprepared--I've seen the reports. Severe psychological effects are common.
You should speak with Talan-De, a Voss commando stationed in the area. He supposedly knows of a way to avoid or prevent these effects.
I'll find Talan-De and see what he knows.
Will do.
I don't know if I've been anywhere as strange as Voss.
This planet is very weird.
Neither have I. It's certainly fascinating, but that doesn't lessen its dangers.
Sounds like superstitious nonsense to me.
I'm not worried about it.
The galaxy is full of strange things. Please, at least speak with Talan-De.
Go as fast as you can, Major. There isn't a moment to lose.
You arrive as predicted. We return alone.
I'd be happy to escort you back to Voss-Ka, sir.
If you wish.
We return alone.
What do you mean, I arrived as predicted?
"As predicted"?
What I say.
I risked my life coming here. A little appreciation would be nice.
No appreciation?
You did your part.
Now we leave.
